controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}.     * To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}."},"getRoleMember(bytes32,uint256)":{"details":"Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive.     * Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point.     * WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information."},"getRoleMemberCount(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role."},"grantRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Grants `role` to `account`.     * If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event.     * Requirements:     * - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role."},"hasRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`."},"isOperator(address)":{"params":{"operator":"Address to check."}},"isRelayer(address)":{"params":{"relayer":"Address to check."}},"paused()":{"details":"Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise."},"renounceAdmin(address)":{"params":{"newAdmin":"Address that admin role will be granted to."}},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account.     * Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced).     * If the calling account had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event.     * Requirements:     * - the caller must be `account`."},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`.     * If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event.     * Requirements:     * - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role."},"transferFunds(address[],uint256[])":{"params":{"addrs":"Array of addresses to transfer {amounts} to.","amounts":"Array of amonuts to transfer to {addrs}."}},"voteProposal(uint8,uint64,bytes32,bytes32)":{"params":{"chainID":"ID of chain deposit originated from.","dataHash":"Hash of data provided when deposit was made.","depositNonce":"ID of deposited generated by origin Bridge contract."}}},"title":"Facilitates deposits, creation and votiing of deposit proposals, and deposit executions."},"userdoc":{"methods":{"adminAddOperator(address)":{"notice":"Grants {operatorAddress} the relayer role and increases {_totalOperator} count.Only callable by an address that currently has the admin role.Emits {OperatorAdded} event."},"adminAddRelayer(address)":{"notice":"Grants {relayerAddress} the relayer role and increases {_totalRelayer} count.Only callable by an address that currently has the admin role.Emits {RelayerAdded} event."},"adminChangeFee(uint256)":{"notice":"Changes deposit fee.Only callable by admin."},"adminChangeRelayerThreshold(uint256)":{"notice":"Modifies the number of votes required for a proposal to be considered passed.Only callable by an address that currently has the admin role.Emits {RelayerThresholdChanged} event."},"adminChangeSpecialFee(uint256,uint8)":{"notice":"Changes deposit fee.Only callable by admin."},"adminPauseTransfers()":{"notice":"Pauses deposits, proposal creation and voting, and deposit executions.Only callable by an address that currently has the admin role."},"adminRemoveOperator(address)":{"notice":"Removes operator role for {operatorAddress} and decreases {_totalOperator} count.Only callable by an address that currently has the admin role.Emits {OperatorRemoved} event."},"adminRemoveRelayer(address)":{"notice":"Removes relayer role for {relayerAddress} and decreases {_totalRelayer} count.Only callable by an address that currently has the admin role.Emits {RelayerRemoved} event."},"adminSetBurnable(address,address)":{"notice":"Sets a resource as burnable for handler contracts that use the IERCHandler interface.Only callable by an address that currently has the admin role."},"adminSetGenericResource(address,bytes32,address,bytes4,uint256,bytes4)":{"notice":"Sets a new resource for handler contracts that use the IGenericHandler interface, and maps the {handlerAddress} to {resourceID} in {_resourceIDToHandlerAddress}.Only callable by an address that currently has the admin role."},"adminSetResource(address,bytes32,address)":{"notice":"Sets a new resource for handler contracts that use the IERCHandler interface, and maps the {handlerAddress} to {resourceID} in {_resourceIDToHandlerAddress}.Only callable by an address that currently has the admin role."},"adminUnpauseTransfers()":{"notice":"Unpauses deposits, proposal creation and voting, and deposit executions.Only callable by an address that currently has the admin role."},"adminUpdateBridgeAddress(address,address)":{"notice":"Used to manually withdraw funds from ERC safes."},"adminWithdraw(address,address,address,uint256)":{"notice":"Used to manually withdraw funds from ERC safes."},"cancelProposal(uint8,uint64,bytes32)":{"notice":"Executes a deposit proposal that is considered passed using a specified handler contract.Only callable by relayers when Bridge is not paused.Proposal must be past expiry threshold.Emits {ProposalEvent} event with status {Cancelled}."},"constructor":"Initializes Bridge, creates and grants {msg.sender} the admin role, creates and grants {initialRelayers} the relayer role.","deposit(uint8,bytes32,bytes)":{"notice":"Initiates a transfer using a specified handler contract.Only callable when Bridge is not paused.Emits {Deposit} event."},"depositETH(uint8,bytes32,bytes)":{"notice":"Initiates a transfer using a specified handler contract.Only callable when Bridge is not paused.Emits {Deposit} event."},"executeProposal(uint8,uint64,bytes,bytes32)":{"notice":"Executes a deposit proposal that is considered passed using a specified handler contract.Only callable by relayers when Bridge is not paused.Proposal must have Passed status.Hash of {data} must equal proposal's {dataHash}.Emits {ProposalEvent} event with status {Executed}."},"getProposal(uint8,uint64,bytes32)":{"notice":"Returns a proposal."},"isOperator(address)":{"notice":"Returns true if {operator} has the operator role."},"isRelayer(address)":{"notice":"Returns true if {relayer} has the relayer role."},"renounceAdmin(address)":{"notice":"Removes admin role from {msg.sender} and grants it to {newAdmin}.Only callable by an address that currently has the admin role."},"transferFunds(address[],uint256[])":{"notice":"Transfers eth in the contract to the specified addresses. The parameters addrs and amounts are mapped 1-1. This means that the address at index 0 for addrs will receive the amount (in WEI) from amounts at index 0."},"voteProposal(uint8,uint64,bytes32,bytes32)":{"notice":"When called, {msg.sender} will be marked as voting in favor of proposal.Only callable by relayers when Bridge is not paused.Proposal must not have already been passed or executed.{msg.sender} must not have already voted on devdoc.author: ChainSafe Systems.

params.operatorAddress: Address of operator to be added.

params.relayerAddress: Address of relayer to be added.

params.operatorAddress: Address of relayer to be removed.

params.relayerAddress: Address of relayer to be removed.

params.handlerAddress: Address of handler resource will be set for.
params.tokenAddress: Address of contract to be called when a deposit is made and a deposited is executed.

params.contractAddress: Address of contract to be called when a deposit is made and a deposited is executed.
params.handlerAddress: Address of handler resource will be set for.
params.resourceID: ResourceID to be used when making deposits.

params.handlerAddress: Address of handler resource will be set for.
params.resourceID: ResourceID to be used when making deposits.
params.tokenAddress: Address of contract to be called when a deposit is made and a deposited is executed.

params.handlerAddress: Address of handler to withdraw from.

params.amountOrTokenID: Either the amount of ERC20 tokens or the ERC721 token ID to withdraw.
params.handlerAddress: Address of handler to withdraw from.

params.chainID: ID of chain deposit originated from.
params.dataHash: Hash of data originally provided when deposit was made.
params.depositNonce: ID of deposited generated by origin Bridge contract.

params.chainID: ID of chain the Bridge contract exists on.
params.initialRelayerThreshold: Number of votes needed for a deposit proposal to be considered passed.
params.initialRelayers: Addresses that should be initially granted the relayer role.

params.data: Additional data to be passed to specified handler.
params.destinationChainID: ID of chain deposit will be bridged to.
params.resourceID: ResourceID used to find address of handler to be used for deposit.

params.data: Additional data to be passed to specified handler.
params.destinationChainID: ID of chain deposit will be bridged to.
params.resourceID: ResourceID used to find address of handler to be used for deposit.

params.chainID: ID of chain deposit originated from.
params.data: Data originally provided when deposit was made.
params.depositNonce: ID of deposited generated by origin Bridge contract.
params.resourceID: ResourceID to be used when making deposits.

params.dataHash: Hash of data to be provided when deposit proposal is executed.
params.depositNonce: ID of proposal generated by proposal's origin Bridge contract.

returns._0: Proposal which consists of: - _dataHash Hash of data to be provided when deposit proposal is executed. - _yesVotes Number of votes in favor of proposal. - _noVotes Number of votes against proposal. - _status Current status of proposal.

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}.     * To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

getRoleMember(bytes32,uint256).details: Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive.     * Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point.     * WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information.

getRoleMemberCount(bytes32).details: Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`.     * If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event.     * Requirements:     * - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

params.newAdmin: Address that admin role will be granted to.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account.     * Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced).     * If the calling account had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event.     * Requirements:     * - the caller must be `account`.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`.     * If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event.     * Requirements:     * - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

params.addrs: Array of addresses to transfer {amounts} to.
params.amounts: Array of amonuts to transfer to {addrs}.

params.chainID: ID of chain deposit originated from.
params.dataHash: Hash of data provided when deposit was made.
params.depositNonce: ID of deposited generated by origin Bridge contract.

devdoc.title: Facilitates deposits, creation and votiing of deposit proposals, and deposit executions.

adminAddOperator(address).notice: Grants {operatorAddress} the relayer role and increases {_totalOperator} count.Only callable by an address that currently has the admin role.Emits {OperatorAdded} event.

adminAddRelayer(address).notice: Grants {relayerAddress} the relayer role and increases {_totalRelayer} count.Only callable by an address that currently has the admin role.Emits {RelayerAdded} event.

adminChangeFee(uint256).notice: Changes deposit fee.Only callable by admin.

adminChangeRelayerThreshold(uint256).notice: Modifies the number of votes required for a proposal to be considered passed.Only callable by an address that currently has the admin role.Emits {RelayerThresholdChanged} event.

adminChangeSpecialFee(uint256,uint8).notice: Changes deposit fee.Only callable by admin.

adminPauseTransfers().notice: Pauses deposits, proposal creation and voting, and deposit executions.Only callable by an address that currently has the admin role.

adminRemoveOperator(address).notice: Removes operator role for {operatorAddress} and decreases {_totalOperator} count.Only callable by an address that currently has the admin role.Emits {OperatorRemoved} event.

adminRemoveRelayer(address).notice: Removes relayer role for {relayerAddress} and decreases {_totalRelayer} count.Only callable by an address that currently has the admin role.Emits {RelayerRemoved} event.

adminSetBurnable(address,address).notice: Sets a resource as burnable for handler contracts that use the IERCHandler interface.Only callable by an address that currently has the admin role.

adminSetGenericResource(address,bytes32,.notice: Sets a new resource for handler contracts that use the IGenericHandler interface, and maps the {handlerAddress} to {resourceID} in {_resourceIDToHandlerAddress}.Only callable by an address that currently has the admin role.

adminSetResource(address,bytes32,address.notice: Sets a new resource for handler contracts that use the IERCHandler interface, and maps the {handlerAddress} to {resourceID} in {_resourceIDToHandlerAddress}.Only callable by an address that currently has the admin role.

adminUnpauseTransfers().notice: Unpauses deposits, proposal creation and voting, and deposit executions.Only callable by an address that currently has the admin role.

adminUpdateBridgeAddress(address,address.notice: Used to manually withdraw funds from ERC safes.

adminWithdraw(address,address,address,ui.notice: Used to manually withdraw funds from ERC safes.

cancelProposal(uint8,uint64,bytes32).notice: Executes a deposit proposal that is considered passed using a specified handler contract.Only callable by relayers when Bridge is not paused.Proposal must be past expiry threshold.Emits {ProposalEvent} event with status {Cancelled}.

methods.constructor: Initializes Bridge, creates and grants {msg.sender} the admin role, creates and grants {initialRelayers} the relayer role.

deposit(uint8,bytes32,bytes).notice: Initiates a transfer using a specified handler contract.Only callable when Bridge is not paused.Emits {Deposit} event.

depositETH(uint8,bytes32,bytes).notice: Initiates a transfer using a specified handler contract.Only callable when Bridge is not paused.Emits {Deposit} event.

executeProposal(uint8,uint64,bytes,bytes.notice: Executes a deposit proposal that is considered passed using a specified handler contract.Only callable by relayers when Bridge is not paused.Proposal must have Passed status.Hash of {data} must equal proposal's {dataHash}.Emits {ProposalEvent} event with status {Executed}.

isOperator(address).notice: Returns true if {operator} has the operator role.

isRelayer(address).notice: Returns true if {relayer} has the relayer role.

renounceAdmin(address).notice: Removes admin role from {msg.sender} and grants it to {newAdmin}.Only callable by an address that currently has the admin role.

transferFunds(address[],uint256[]).notice: Transfers eth in the contract to the specified addresses. The parameters addrs and amounts are mapped 1-1. This means that the address at index 0 for addrs will receive the amount (in WEI) from amounts at index 0.

voteProposal(uint8,uint64,bytes32,bytes3.notice: When called, {msg.sender} will be marked as voting in favor of proposal.Only callable by relayers when Bridge is not paused.Proposal must not have already been passed or executed.{msg.sender} must not have already voted on proposal.Emits {ProposalEvent} event with status indicating the proposal status.Emits {ProposalVote} event.
